channel.title: [C4D] Livin' Room [Updated]
channel.description:
[img]http://img153.imageshack.us/img153/4601/livinroomlampwz2.png[/img]
Living room updated, i went into thinking about how bright it really is inside a living room, its actually kinda soft, added a lamp, the shade needs a texture and a bit more work [img]http://img297.imageshack.us/img297/3826/livingroom32is1.png[/img]
Took me a bit, please suggest on things to improve :)

item.title: [C4D] Livin' Room [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Thats what im planning on doing

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:44, topic:187997”]Yeah.

Treat it this way. Don’t detail afterwards. From the start, make EVERYTHING and treat it as if it were it’s OWN object, not in a room.

Then when it’s all together, fix the clashing things.

Don’t put just a box for a TV or a cabinet or anything.

Model out a damn good cabinet and TV, and put them in the room.[/quote]
Alrighty

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Livin' Room [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

You should really work on a single project before taking on an entire room. Make a small scale object with great detail.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Livin' Room [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Yeah.

Treat it this way. Don’t detail afterwards. From the start, make EVERYTHING and treat it as if it were it’s OWN object, not in a room.

Then when it’s all together, fix the clashing things.

Don’t put just a box for a TV or a cabinet or anything.

Model out a damn good cabinet and TV, and put them in the room.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Livin' Room [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:42, topic:187997”]Wooden floor reflections are still bad. You’re never going to see a perfectly reflective wooden floor. Give it some dispersion and still tone it down a notch.

You’ve also got some bad phong shading on the floor/wall seperator. Looks as if there should be a hard shadow right underneath it which is pretty drastic.[/quote]
Im probly going to just start over I started adding detailed things after the living room was all filled in etc. So next time i can do it first.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Livin' Room [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Wooden floor reflections are still bad. You’re never going to see a perfectly reflective wooden floor. Give it some dispersion and still tone it down a notch.

You’ve also got some bad phong shading on the floor/wall seperator. Looks as if there should be a hard shadow right underneath it which is pretty drastic.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Livin' Room [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:40, topic:187997”]It still has a ways to go though.

To be honest, it looks like a “blocked” out scene.

What I mean is, something someone would do BEFORE they make their scene, just to get the feel for it.

That’s what is stopping this one.[/quote]
I see what you mean, i went ahead and gave it some textures, and tried to get the more ‘real’ feel.
I might just start over on a new one, this one i started when i wasnt sure really about anything. But if i start new i can use all the things i know now, like modeling the cabinets first so its not to laggy Before i get into details etc.

http://img526.imageshack.us/img526/8712/livingroom3aj7.png

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Livin' Room [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“nator123123, post:35, topic:187997”]Living room looks good. Here’s my list:

Reflection: A little more less reflecty.
Shadow: Good.
Wall: Needs TEXTURE! Come on…
Door: WAY too much reflect, that’s like a black mirror. Since it’s a see-through door, your supposed to be able to see the other room or outside, aren’t you?
Picture on wall: Needs work, it’s too simple and basic.
Others: good.

If only a few are good and they are clutched together and the background is ugly, omgzers!

6/10[/quote]
Door: Its night outside, an bright in the room, but a bit less reflect will help
Picture: Forgot to add a reflection.

EDIT: Added a lamp, the shade needs a bit more work.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Livin' Room [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:34, topic:187997”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=250643.msg2102380#msg2102380 date=1205221136]

I don’t know.

I know every now and then my computer will go back to the Log In screen.

But when I log in everything is exactly how it was left.
[/quote]
My computer usually goes into sleep after a while so my best bet is that.

Also, do you have any tips on improving the cabinets?[/quote]

Model them out.

Look up cabinet pictures on the net and pick one to model. I would probably go for one with the moulding inside of it. Then make the moulding with Adobe Illustrator, import it as a spline, and use that to make the moulding model.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Livin' Room [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Living room looks good. Here’s my list:

Reflection: A little more less reflecty.
Shadow: Good.
Wall: Needs TEXTURE! Come on…
Door: WAY too much reflect, that’s like a black mirror. Since it’s a see-through door, your supposed to be able to see the other room or outside, aren’t you?
Picture on wall: Needs work, it’s too simple and basic.
Others: good.

If only a few are good and they are clutched together and the background is ugly, omgzers!

6/10

Read full topic
